Sentencas: Point defects largely govern the electrochemical properties of oxides: at low defect concentrations, conductivity increases with concentration; however, at higher concentrations, defect - defect interactions start to dominate(1,2).
Titulo: Disruption of extended defects in solid oxide fuel cell anodes for methane oxidation

Sentencas: Thus, in searching for electrochemically active materials for fuel cell anodes, high defect concentration is generally avoided.
Titulo: Disruption of extended defects in solid oxide fuel cell anodes for methane oxidation

Sentencas: Here we describe an oxide anode formed from lanthanum-substituted strontium titanate (La-SrTiO3) in which we control the oxygen stoichiometry in order to break down the extended defect intergrowth regions and create phases with considerable disordered oxygen defects.
Titulo: Disruption of extended defects in solid oxide fuel cell anodes for methane oxidation

Sentencas: We substitute Ti in these phases with Ga and Mn to induce redox activity and allow more flexible coordination.
Titulo: Disruption of extended defects in solid oxide fuel cell anodes for methane oxidation

Sentencas: The material demonstrates impressive fuel cell performance using wet hydrogen at 950 degrees C.
Titulo: Disruption of extended defects in solid oxide fuel cell anodes for methane oxidation

Sentencas: It is also important for fuel cell technology to achieve efficient electrode operation with different hydrocarbon fuels(3,4), although such fuels are more demanding than pure hydrogen.
Titulo: Disruption of extended defects in solid oxide fuel cell anodes for methane oxidation

Sentencas: The best anode materials to date-Ni-YSZ ( yttria-stabilized zirconia) cermets(5) - suffer some disadvantages related to low tolerance to sulphur(6), carbon build-up when using hydrocarbon fuels(7) ( though device modifications and lower temperature operation can avoid this(8,9)) and volume instability on redox cycling.
Titulo: Disruption of extended defects in solid oxide fuel cell anodes for methane oxidation

Sentencas: Our anode material is very active for methane oxidation at high temperatures, with open circuit voltages in excess of 1.2 V. The materials design concept that we use here could lead to devices that enable more-efficient energy extraction from fossil fuels and carbon-neutral fuels.
Titulo: Disruption of extended defects in solid oxide fuel cell anodes for methane oxidation
